column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Have taken for 20+ years. Started taking after dignosed with Epstein Barr and depression. Works well. About twice a year for some reason I go through a week to ten days of mild depression, but over all it works for me. Tried the generic to save money, not as effective. Tried a newer drug some years back on new doctor's recommendation with bad experience, went back to norpramin. Old rule, "If it works, stay with it."

column2: none, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had burning in my legs for five years before a neurologist put me on norpramin. The pain was gone in a week, after 6 months I stopped taking it, and the burning never came back. Did affect ejaculation

column2: Azelya, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was put on this for headaches. It was the first pill of five that has done any good, but only at the max dosage. So far I love it, if I don't miss any dosages. :) I seem to get sunburns easily, I'm glad someone else mentioned constipation. I do seem to have that problem for sometime, it now makes sense. I've had problems sleeping as well, which is weird since I sleep like the dead. When i first started, or went on a higher dosage, I was tired practically all day for a week or two. Can't say I'm a depressed person, but my husband has mentioned that I seem happier lately. But I've also had a long break from working too. Anyways, my point, I've had several side effects, but I think it's well worth it.

column2: krasi, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It works really great since I have been on almost 90% of depression meds and this it the only one that works. The down side is I sweat buckets all day. I have few choices in meds so I have to deal with the constant sweating and it is terrible.

column2: new33here, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Out of all the anti-depressants available, this tri-cyclic worked the best for me...It broke through the depression along with Pamalor......I am very thankful for this...

column2: Rob, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I just started taking 100 mg at bedtime. But, I have been very constipated while being on this medicine. Im gona have to talk to the doctor about the constipation problem and hopefully it will go away as I take this longer.

column2: LSC1212, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Took this medication for about one year and when the physician increased the dosage it caused me to suffer sudden cardiac death.  Thankfully my wife was in the same room when it happened and she knew CPR.  If it wasn't for her this drug (drug class) would of killed me!!

column2: jmanders2008, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: My doctor started me first on desipramine (generic version of Norpramin) without success. However when he started me on Norpramin (brand version), I started seeing the first signs of improvement in almost two years. I have been taking the drug now for about twelve years, and will be on it as a measure of prevention for the rest of my life.

column2: jojoba, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i do get some relief from the pain but not enough when it comes

column2: mary, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: have been taking for about 10 yrs--suffered from severe depression prior to taking it--has worked so well, i'll probably take it for the rest of my life--

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
Rex, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Use 25 mg daily at night to augment Prozac.  I sleep better and feel better the next day.  Works well for me and as a generic, cost is not significant.

column2: lori, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Iv'e been on this med.for 10yrs.for stomach spas.Later lost all use of colon,Dr. states that this med.could paralize colon after long period of use,haven't regained use of colon after going off of med.(yet)only been off med.for 2wks.If anyone has went off this med.please let me know when side effects ezeup,having hard time.

column2: stebar, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I've had to continue to encrease about over the years. I'm up to 250mg daily.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more
column9: Awesome Antidepressant with minimal side effects (dry mouth) so I chew alot of gum. I am a healthy 35 year old Male and have used since age 20. Would highly highly recommend this medication for depression. Not addictive or anything of that nature but I find it works for me so will probably take for life.

column2: Jersey Girl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Began use after family crisis and onset of menapause.  25-50 mg was beneficial in mood elevating and less depression. After 10 years of use I find it helps with mental alertness and less fatigue.
